wikipedia_page.main: Jesse David Watts-Russell (1812 – 7 March 1879) was a British Conservative politician.He was the son of Jesse Watts-Russell, an MP for Gatton and Mary Watts, and married Mary Nevill Wright, daughter of John Smith Wright and Lydia Gray, and had at least nine children, including Josephine (died c. 1893).Watts-Russell was elected Conservative MP for North Staffordshire at the 1841 general election, and held the seat until 1852 when he stood down.He was also, at some point, a Justice of the Peace.
